name: Maureen Allanic
title: Bridging Space Exploration and Digital Innovation
summary: Rapid Prototyping Team Lead at the European Space Agency, empowering space experts through advanced AI capabilities. I combine the rigor of space engineering with the agility of a serial entrepreneur. From co-founding businesses to leading cross-functional tech teams, I focus on turning bold ideas into functional prototypes. Driven by curiosity and always seeking the next challenge.

experience.role: Professional in AI & Emerging Technology Platforms
highlights: Engage with customers and stakeholders to elicit requirements, constraints, and expectations for the AI & Emerging Technology Platform
Collaborate with teams to define governance policies for AI/ML and emerging technology adoption, ensuring compliance and scalability
Integrated third-party APIs into internal systems, automating workflows and reducing manual processes by 20%
Design and deliver AI training programs for beginners across the agency
Building a network of venture-minded ESA professionals
Establishing communication link between Young Professionals and ESA Business Incubation Centres
Provided knowledge management support to space exploration projects (ISS Operations, Orion, I-HAB, ESPRIT, ExoMars, ERO MSR)
Implemented processes for personal data protection, security, and quality management
Designed and delivered training on process best practices and knowledge management tools
Involved in planning, analysis, development, testing, implementation and rollout of customer projects
Provided international communication services to luxury brands (Cartier, Longchamp, Rolex, Galeries Lafayette)
Contributed to high-growth startup, supporting cross-functional teams
Monitored implementation of various client IT projects and regional initiatives
Identified business opportunities with IBM Track & Trace blockchain, IBM Cloud, IBM Watson
Provided customized web analytics services to 10+ clients from various sectors
Managed dataLayers implementation, data collection, cleaning, and analysis
Conducted A/B testing and analyzed online marketing strategies

certifications.title: Drone pilot A1/A3

certifications.title: Space Sustainability
certifications.description: The goal of the course is to learn what space sustainability means and how to design, operate missions and how to manage space business with a sustainability perspective.

certifications.title: Designing Space Missions & Systems
certifications.description: 26-hour Designing Space Missions & Systems workshop which examines the real-world application of the entire space systems operations and engineering discipline.

certifications.title: AI Strategies and Roadmap: Systems Engineering Approach

projects.name: Gravity Assist - ESA Internal Incubator
projects.description: Co-launched ESA's internal startup incubator 2025 to accelerate innovation and bypass bureaucratic hurdles. Organized a 3-day intrapreneurship event yielding 5 winning teams (from 25) who received €30k funding and 6 months of coaching.

projects.name: YPSat - Young Professionals Satellite
projects.description: ESA's Young Professionals Satellite project, participating in the Ariane 6 maiden flight. Led communications coordination for a multidisciplinary, multicultural team.

projects.name: OUispeak Solutions
projects.description: Co-founded the company in 2017, a technology company specialising in remote interpretation solutions for multilingual events.nternational communication services platform serving luxury brands including Cartier, Longchamp, Rolex, and Galeries Lafayette.

projects.name: Smart Green Pallet - IBM
projects.description: Co-creation of a smart green pallet. Incorporating IoT sensors and RFID tags allows for real-time monitoring of the pallet's location, condition, and inventory levels. This ensures better supply chain management and tracking efficiency. PoC developed for CMA CGM.

projects.name: Lola by Sonora Labs: Strategy Project
projects.description: The project was done as a course work in IAE Aix-Marseille Graduate School of Management and the results were delivered to Sonora Labs. Strategic market analysis for a French start-up company providing a blockchain-based private cloud solution.

projects.name: BGO Mobility - Rickshaws Mobility App
projects.description: Worked on Bgo Mobility project. An early stage start-up aiming to improve the urban mobility on how we travel in rickshaws in the cities of India. The project focus to create and deliver a whole new experience on how we commute from different parts of the city.

awards.title: 1st Winner - MBSE 2024 Hackathon
awards.description: Conceptual Design for a Greenhouse Module on the Moon using MBSE and SysML. Our team designed Vertigo, a lunar greenhouse module ensuring future moon inhabitants have fresh veggies.

awards.title: 1st Winner - Mistral AI Hackathon 2024
awards.description: Our team won the Mistral AI Paris Hackathon 2024 (Mistral API track), the largest ever french hackathon. We've successfully built Le ChatOn Vision, a multi-modal RAG system that allows for natural video analysis in real-time, reducing workload and boosting efficiency. Inspired by Project Astra, it aims to provide a chat-like experience for analyzing video data captured by autonomous systems like drones or robots.

awards.title: 1st Winner - Contest 'Imagine my life in the future of farming'
awards.description: A competition to invite Bretons to share their vision of the pig farming of tomorrow. Participants were invited to provide concrete proposals to improve welfare in pig farming. Won with a 3D modelisation of tomorrow's farm.

awards.title: 1st Winner - Competition Tremplin Sud Award at Le Phare de l'entrepreneuriat
awards.description: Challenge among 100+ promising start-ups from the south region of France.

awards.title: 1st Winner - IBM x Intrum Hackathon for financial wellbeing
awards.description: While I was a student studying Information Systems at the School of Economics in Turku, Finland, I participated in a hackathon jointly organized by Tieto, Intrum, IBM, and Nordic Finance Innovation. This European challenge featured 13 diverse teams competing to develop innovative solutions. Our project utilized IBM Watson to create a groundbreaking service for managing personal finances, aimed at enhancing customer experience through effective use of data and public APIs.

publications.title: Hear from an ESA Junior Professional: Maureen
publications.description: The European Space Agency's Junior Professional Programme (JPP) is now open for applications—an exciting gateway for junior professionals eager to launch their careers in the space sector. Among the many success stories to come out of the programme is Maureen, a Junior Professional whose journey at ESA included leading innovation within the IT Department and contributing to pioneering projects like YPSat-1, a satellite mission driven entirely by the Young ESA community. With hands-on experience, international collaboration and personal growth at its core, the JPP offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of space while developing your own professional path – as Maureen demonstrates in this interview.

publications.title: Tintin, c'est l'aventure
publications.description: A special edition of the quarterly magazine Tintin, c'est l'aventure launched in France, Belgium and Luxembourg on 13 December 2023. The new issue invites readers to join Tintin on a fact-packed journey of space exploration, with features, interviews and activities focused on real-life space missions. This new adventure for Tintin and his friends is the most recent product of a long cooperation between ESA and the magazine's publishers Prisma Press, Geo magazine and Éditions Moulinsart.

publications.title: SROnto: An ontology describing the space resources domain
publications.publisher: Luxembourg Institute of Science and Technology, European Space Research and Technology Centre
publications.description: The growing interest for space resources by international governments, space agencies, and the private sector, generates a vast and dynamic amount of heterogeneous data, information, and knowledge as reflected in the number of scientific publications, patents, reports, and even news and reports regularly published in different medias. These are centralized via a recently launched Knowledge Sharing Platform that allows to federate the space resources community. The Space Resources Ontology (SROnto) that is described here, is at the heart of this platform since it drives the integration of knowledge into this platform but also support knowledge extraction and management. In this paper, we explain the various steps we have followed to conceptualize, formalize, validate and maintain the ontology over time as well as other important aspects such as its potential impact to become a standard for the community. We further pay a particular attention to the FAIR principles and their incidence on SROnto.

publications.title: Towards a tokenization of carbon credits: an application of blockchain technology to emission trading system
publications.publisher: Tilburg University, Turku School of Economics, IAE Aix Marseille
publications.description: Across the world, climate change is today one of the most major challenges of our time. Against it, several initiatives have been developed. One of them has the goal to cope with polluting emissions released into the atmosphere: The Emission Trading System. However, its success is threatened by several difficulties: frauds, lack of transparency, absence of standards and so on. All of these factors restrain Emissions Trading Systems to efficiently reduce global carbon footprint. This study investigates the potential of blockchain technology features applied the infrastructure of an emission trading system. In this perspective, this master thesis intends to demonstrate how blockchain can favor Emission Trading System mechanisms and prevent fraud issues from occurring. Analysis through surveys and semi structured interviews among experienced professionals have been realized in order to demonstrate and evaluate the feasibility of the designed system.
